Samiul Haque, PhD

Strategic Advisor | Enterprise Data, AI, & Analytics

Summary

Solutions Architect with 10+ years of experience across data engineering, applied AI, and analytics. Consistent top performer: Top 2% (3-time Customer Advisory Excellence Award winner) at SAS and Top 1% (among 1000+ engineers) at Samsung. Proven record delivering $100M+ pipeline impact through enterprise solution design, RFP strategy, and executive-level demonstrations. Experienced in mapping complex business problems into technical solutions that fit customer workflows. Strong advocate for customer needs in product discussions.

Core Skills

Solution Architecture • AI/ML & GenAI Solution Design • Customer Advisory & Value Mapping • Proof-of-Value Development • Executive Storytelling • Data Engineering & ETL Optimization • Life Sciences Domain Expertise

Awards & Recognitions

  • Customer Advisory Excellence Award winner three consecutive years (FY22-FY24), Top 2% of global presales organization
  • Ranked top 1% in Samsung’s annual programming assessment (2014, 2015) among 1000+ global engineers

Experience

SAS Institute | Sr. Presales Engineer – Healthcare & Life Sciences Customer Advisory

Cary, NC | August 2022 – Present

  • Supported enterprise deal cycles across 20+ Fortune 500 pharmaceutical, biotech, and CRO accounts, generating >$100M qualified pipeline
  • Led discovery, qualification, RFP strategy, and C-suite briefings (VP/Chief Data Officer level) for $1-13M ARR enterprise data and AI platform selections
  • Built and delivered GenAI proof-of-value demos integrating RAG pipelines and MCP servers, accelerating platform evaluation cycles and differentiating against competitive alternatives
  • Delivered 100+ customer demos, workshops, and PoCs across real-world evidence (RWE), commercial analytics, and clinical R&D use cases (SCE, CDR); shortened sales cycles by ≈30%
  • Partnered with GSIs (Accenture, Deloitte) and cloud vendors (AWS, Azure) to design and deploy GxP compliant compute environment for Fortune 100 pharma clients
  • Created AI/ML prototypes using 20TB real-world data (RWD) to support trial feasibility, synthetic control arm analysis, and regulatory submission workflows
  • Mentored 2 interns and 2 junior engineers on presales process, demo development, and executive presentation skills

SAS Institute | Presales Engineer – Healthcare & Life Sciences Customer Advisory

Cary, NC | March 2021 – August 2022

  • Supported $40M+ qualified pipeline across 10+ enterprise pharmaceutical and biotech accounts
  • Delivered 50+ technical evaluations and proof-of-concepts with conversion to qualified opportunity stage
  • Improved ETL efficiency in data warehouse migration projects by optimizing SQL and Snowflake macros, reducing customer infrastructure costs by ≈25%
  • Designed ML-based batch optimization solution for pharmaceutical manufacturing to increase yield and throughput
  • Created AI/ML prototypes using 20TB real-world data for trial feasibility and external control arm analysis supporting regulatory submissions
  • Co-authored industry whitepapers and delivered conference presentations (PHUSE, PharmaSUG, FDA CSS) to establish thought leadership and generate qualified leads
  • Led hands-on workshops for multiple SAS Viya customers (>$2MM ARR), driving more widespread use of SAS products and wider and deeper adoption of ML & AI on SAS Viya platform
  • Developed reusable enablement assets including webinars, community blogs, and workshop scripts that expanded the presales team’s reach and improved consistency in customer engagements

SAS Institute | Graduate Intern (Year-Round)

Cary, NC | May 2019 – February 2021

  • Developed agricultural data model and deep learning pipeline (Keras, TensorFlow) for decision support platform, leading to a full-time offer
  • Created data dictionary and ML models for crop phenotyping using high-throughput imagery

Samsung R&D Institute | Sr. Software Engineer

Dhaka, Bangladesh | January 2014 – June 2015

  • Promoted to Senior Software Engineer based on technical contributions and project delivery
  • Led computer vision and ML algorithm development for Samsung Galaxy camera systems; delivered 5+ research prototypes to product teams
  • Mentored 2 interns on algorithm optimization, code quality, and research methodologies

Samsung R&D Institute | Software Engineer

Dhaka, Bangladesh | May 2012 – January 2014

  • Contributed to Galaxy camera feature development and prototype delivery
